snippet: Willem van Aelst’s still lifes, while manifestly objects of extraordinary artifice, are experienced as uncannily present, as if they were hallucinated.
abstract: Ken Johnson reviews paintings by Willem van Aelst at the National Gallery in Washington, DC.
lead_paragraph: Willem van Aelst’s still lifes, while manifestly objects of extraordinary artifice, are experienced as uncannily present, as if they were hallucinated.

headline.seo: Willem van Aelst Still-Life Paintings at National Gallery
headline.main: Pronks for the Memory: Rendering Luxury
headline.print_headline: Pronks for the Memory: Rendering Luxury
